item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
Age of Steam
item.comment: I think it's a great game, but there is no reason for having two almost the same games (Steam & AoS). And Steam maps look much better.

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Mississippi Steamboats / Golden Spike
Age of Steam Expansion: Sun / London
item.comment: Union overtime fees are horrible!

item.name: Agricola: Chłopi i ich zwierzyniec
item.originalname: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small

item.name: Amber
item.comment: If you want to play a tile placing game just take Carcassonne or anything better.

item.name: BANG!
item.comment: "Come on! Play Bang with us! Bang! Bang! Bang! [I didn't have any useful cards] Now it would be your turn, if you weren't dead."

item.name: BioShock Infinite: The Siege of Columbia
Blueprints
item.comment: I don't like most of dice games, but during last Essen something has changed. Blueprints is a nice looking game, architectonic theme pleases me, dice are aesthetic (better than in eg. Quantum or Steam Park) and there is no stupid mechanism that spoils your chance to win not because you have no plan but because of some unlucky roll.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: Lot of fun, simple rules, not too much space needed. It's a game to play everywhere with anyone.

item.name: Carcassonne: Wheel of Fortune
item.comment: Much worse than a base game. Players didn't want to put their meeples on the wheel tile. The pig brought another big amount of randomness. I prefer the old expansions.

item.name: A Castle for All Seasons
item.comment: It's a very short game. First few turns for strategic decisions and then realisation with little tactic movements and careful turn counting.

item.name: Castles of Mad King Ludwig
item.comment: I had so much fun playing it!

item.name: La Città
item.comment: Very simple rules, many strategies to think about, direct confrontation with the opponent - everything I like.

item.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
Continental Express
item.comment: Looks so cute. I'm really sorry it isn't any better.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: I wasn't expecting much, maybe some new variants of same old cards and ideas. But Intrigue appeared as something completely new and fresh.

item.name: Dominion: Rozdarte Królestwo
item.comment: Everywhere, anytime, with anyone. It's a game to play, shuffle and play again and again.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Felix: The Cat in the Sack
Funkenschlag: Flux-Generator
item.comment: Just another power plant, quite efficient.

item.name: Funkenschlag: Umspannwerk
item.comment: Very useful expansion. I took it once and it helped me to avoid one power plant replacement.

item.name: Giza
item.comment: Extremely fast filler game for people who are to tired to think, but still not enough tired to laugh.

item.name: Hazienda
item.comment: Good game for playing with invited non-geek friends. Simple but with many features that good eurogame should have to interest innocent people :>

item.name: Horror w Arkham
item.comment: I don't like most of so called 'ameritrash' games, but this boardgame and RPG mashup gives me a lot of fun. After playing AH I've started reading lovecraftian stories.

item.name: In the Shadow of the Emperor
Jenga
item.comment: Very good party game with the simpliest rules they can be. Great emotions, especially when game is served with alcohol ;)

item.name: Kakerlakensuppe
item.comment: Old guys were playing and slurping like babies :P

item.name: Keyflower: Emporium & Monument
item.comment: I thought it will be just two more tiles expansion. It appeared the players very like them and if possible they choose them as the scoring tiles for winter auction.

item.name: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
item.wishlistcomment: I'd been pretty sure I want that game, but Arkham Horror took it's place.

item.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy
The Little Prince: Make Me a Planet
Lord of the Rings
item.comment: Four plays in a row. That's not usual for a non-party game.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: Friends & Foes
item.comment: I've never played without this expansion, so can't really rate it right.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation (Deluxe Edition)
The Magnates: A Game of Power
item.comment: A very good game. As an orthodox eurogamer I usually don't give 7 to games like that, but I'll make an exception.

item.name: Mali Powstańcy: Warszawa 1944
item.comment: First play. We have lost only one part of Warsaw and no cooperation was needed. And I'd rather sacrifice myself for Galactica than for the whole city in this game. However rate 6 means - ok game.

item.name: Memorable Stories
item.comment: Like in rating description: won't play this again. Story Cubes at least don't pretend being a game.

item.name: Miliard w rozumie
item.comment: Good game for kids who like to devour knowledge. Unfortunately only for kids.

item.name: Munchkin Cthulhu 3: The Unspeakable Vault
item.comment: Goomi's illustrations are the best, yum yum :)

item.name: Neuroshima Hex!
item.comment: My first contact with modern eurogames. After many new games I still find it fun.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
Owczy Pęd
item.comment: Quite good game for the first contact with logic games. The sheeps are so cute, that it's easy to invite to play many nongamers.

item.name: Pick-a-Polar Bear
item.comment: I was stuck at the Essen booth for many plays ;)

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth: Expansion Set
item.comment: This expansion makes good game better.

item.name: PitchCar Mini
item.comment: This year there were so many parties I visited only with Jenga and Jungle Speed. Now I know what was the missing element ;)

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Risk
item.comment: Seven armies were attacking one. And what happened? They all failed. That is not a random factor I like. Previous rating was 4. but I played it again :(

item.name: Risk (Revised Edition)
item.comment: Previously the rating was 4. but I gave it another chance and now I'm sure I won't play it anymore under no circumstances. This game should end after the first dice roll: whoever got the highest result - wins. That would be faster and equally random (but less irritating).

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Scrabble
item.comment: Playing with experienced gamers was a bit strange: "Yes, this word exists. It's a name of very rare chemical laboratory equipment (in accusativ and plural)."

item.name: Steam Park
item.comment: Had a lot of fun, but rolling dies as fast as you can is not what I'm looking for.

item.name: Die Sterne Stehen Richtig
item.comment: Some people are good at finding patterns... I'm definitely not. But I want to try more and beat my personal monster.

item.name: Super Farmer
item.comment: You just have to find a rabbit in yourself ;)

item.name: Templar: The Secret Treasures
item.comment: Everything seems ok, there are typical movement cards, something aggressive (moving doors and gray monk), a little bit of strategy while players fill the docks or take treasures from there, BUT... there's no excitement at all :(

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment: 2nd play: I gave it a second chance. After play I was bored and tired. I really want to find this thing which makes this game so popular and highly rated. But I'm afraid it's beyond my power. Follow the recommendations I should gave it 3. 3rd play: Damn, I like it ;)

item.name: To Court the King
item.comment: Dice management is the only one type of dice rolling game I can play.

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment: I can't help it I just don't need to play it again. There are so many good games (in my opinion much better).

item.name: Wings of War: Immelmann Booster Pack
Wings of War: Watch Your Back!
The Witcher: The Adventure Card Game
